p0.topic: AI safety discourse absent across all six panel sources
p0.summary: Zero signals about AI safety, alignment, governance, or responsible AI from any trust tier this cycle. Reddit's 60 signals span LocalLLaMA, singularity, OpenAI, and MachineLearning — all capabilities-focused. TechMeme's 13 editor-curated stories: zero safety framing. This isn't 'safety is quiet' — it's structurally gone from the conversation during active capabilities discussion. If you track safety-capabilities balance as a leading indicator, the ratio is currently undefined.

p1.topic: LocalLLaMA outpacing r/OpenAI in signal volume and expert convergence
OpenAI primary channel near-silent (1 signal) during high community speculation
TechMeme all-business framing vs Reddit all-implementation framing
